At least a 20 percent reduction of our members’ greenhouse gas emissions from 2005 to 202010 The paper and wood products industry was among the first to take voluntary action to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.
Forests provide an important ecosys- tem service by sequestering carbon and growing trees that release oxygen, supporting life on our planet.

Resolute Forest Products took concrete action to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions at their pulp, paper, tissue and wood products mills across the United States and Canada by improving the energy efficiency of their op- erations, producing renewable energy and managing water efficiently, as well as reducing waste and reliance on fossil fuels.
These actions have allowed Res- olute to reduce their absolute GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) by 81 percent relative to 2000 levels, benefiting both the environment and their bottom line.

Between 2005 and 2018, the mill achieved a 15 percent reduction in overall water use and an 18 percent reduction in water use per ton of paper production, 2018 AF&PA SUSTAINABILITY AWARD WINNER while increasing production by 10 percent.

Specifically, when adjusted to provide greater weight to reductions occurring at mills in water- stressed areas, AF&PA members reduced their process water use by 13.1 percent.14 While we have not achieved our ambitious goal, our progress has shown significant effort to improve water resource management.

Five of our six goals demonstrate AF&PA members’ commitment to environmental stewardship across the entire value chain from the raw, renewable wood fiber that is harvested to the energy and water used in the manufacturing process to the recovery of paper and paper-based pack- aging that is used to make new products.

Not only are our members’ products derived from sustainable forests, the industry is striving to increase their contri- bution to a circular economy, making more with less whenever possible and creat- ing innovative new products that maximize efficient use of resources.
In short, paper and wood products keep lands forested, store carbon, are biode- gradable and support our nation’s recycling system.
We are proud of our achievements and leadership in sustainability and look forward to setting new standards for the decade to come.
